data.name: TextCommandDescription
data.value: Performs waymark preset commands. Use "{0}" for detailed usage information.

data.name: TextCommandResponseHelpSubcommands
data.value: Valid commands are as follows: {0}, {1}, {2}, {3}, {4}, and {5}. If no command is provided, the preset library will be opened. Type "{6} <command>" for detailed subcommand information.

data.name: TextCommandResponseHelpSlotInfo
data.value: Prints the data saved in the game's slots to the chat window. Usage: "{0} slot". The slot number can be any valid game slot.

data.name: TextCommandResponseHelpPlace
data.value: Places the preset with the specified name (if possible). Quotes MUST be used around the name. May also specify preset index without quotes instead. Usage: "{0} <name>|<index>". Name must match exactly (besides case). Index can be any valid libary preset number.

data.name: TextCommandResponseHelpImport
data.value: Copies one of the game's five preset slots to the library. Usage: "{0} slot". The slot number can be any valid game slot. Command-line import of a formatted preset string is not supported due to length restrictions in the game's chat box.

data.name: TextCommandResponseHelpExport
data.value: Copies a preset from the library to the specified game slot *or* copies a preset to the clipboard, depending on flags and parameters. Usage: "{0} [{1}] [{2}] slot|index [slot]". The slot number can be any valid game slot, and index can be any valid library preset number. Use of the {3} flag specifies that the first number is a game slot, not a library index. Use of the {4} flag includes the last-modified time in the clipboard export.

data.name: TextCommandResponseHelpExportAll
data.value: Copies all presets in the library to the clipboard, one per line. Add {0} if you wish to include the last-modified timestamp in the export.

data.name: TextCommandResponseHelp
data.value: Use "{0}" to open the GUI. Use "{1}" for a list of text commands.

data.name: TextCommandResponseSlotInfoError1
data.value: An unknown error occured while trying to read the game's waymark data.

data.name: TextCommandResponseSlotInfoError2
data.value: Unable to read game's waymark data.

data.name: TextCommandResponseSlotInfoError3
data.value: An invalid game slot number was provided.

data.name: TextCommandResponsePlaceError3
data.value: An unknown error occured placing preset {0}.

data.name: TextCommandResponsePlaceError5
data.value: Unable to place preset. This probably means that the plugin needs to be updated for a new version of FFXIV.

data.name: TextCommandResponseImportSuccess1
data.value: Imported game preset {0} as library preset {1}.

data.name: TextCommandResponseImportError1
data.value: An unknown error occured while trying to read the game's waymark data.

data.name: TextCommandResponseImportError2
data.value: Unable to read game's waymark data. This probably means that the plugin needs to be updated for a new version of FFXIV.

data.name: TextCommandResponseImportError3
data.value: An invalid game slot number was provided: "{0}".

data.name: TextCommandResponseExportError1
data.value: No slot or index numbers were provided.

data.name: TextCommandResponseExportError2
data.value: An invalid game slot number ({0}) was provided.

data.name: TextCommandResponseExportError3
data.value: An invalid library index ({0}) was provided.

data.name: TextCommandResponseExportError4
data.value: An invalid game slot number to export ({0}) was provided.

data.name: TextCommandResponseExportError5
data.value: An invalid library index ({0}) was provided.

data.name: TextCommandResponseExportError6
data.value: Unable to write to game slot {0}!

data.name: TextCommandResponseExportError7
data.value: An invalid game slot number ({0}) was provided as the target.

data.name: TextCommandResponseExportError8
data.value: An unknown error occured while trying to export the preset.

data.name: TextCommandResponseExportAllError1
data.value: An unknown error occured while trying to copy presets to clipboard.

data.name: EditWindowTextOOBWarningMessage
data.value: SE has banned people for placing out of bounds waymarks. Please use caution when manually editing waymark coordinates.

data.name: HelpWindowTextGeneral1
data.value: All presets in this plugin's list are fully separate from the game's presets. This allows you to store an unlimited number of presets, as well as to easily back up and share them, or import presets that others have shared with you.

data.name: HelpWindowTextGeneral2
data.value: Selecting a preset in the library will show a window to the side with information about that preset, such as where the waymarks are placed, as well as actions that you can take with that preset.

data.name: HelpWindowTextGeneral3
data.value: If you want to copy a preset in the library to a game slot, select that preset in the list, and then press the button with the number of the slot to which you want to copy it. If you want to import a preset from the game's list into the library, scroll down to "Import Options" and press the button of the slot that you wish to import from the game. This is also where you can paste presets to import them from outside of the game.

data.name: HelpWindowTextGeneral4
data.value: If you wish to share a preset with someone else, you can select the preset in the library, and click the "Export to Clipboard" button.

data.name: HelpWindowTextGeneral5
data.value: The plugin also allows you to place and save waymarks directly to/from the field. These are what the "Place" and "Save Current Waymarks" buttons do. Please note that saving and placing presets is only supported in areas that the game allows with its built in system. Saving presets outside of those duties will result in a preset that shows an unknown zone. Trying to place presets outside of those duties will simply fail to do anything.

data.name: HelpWindowTextGeneral6
data.value: Presets can be reordered in the library by dragging and dropping them at the desired spot. The sorting of duties in the library is by default the same as they are sorted in the game's files, and is approximately the order in which the duties were added to the game. Duties can be drag and drop reordered if desired. If you create your own order by doing this, newly-seen duties will appear at the bottom of the list.

data.name: HelpWindowTextEditingWarningMessage
data.value: SE has banned people for placing out of bounds waymarks. Please use caution when manually editing waymark coordinates.

data.name: HelpWindowTextEditing1
data.value: Clicking the "Edit" button in the preset info pane will bring up a window that allows you to edit a preset. You can adjust any of the available parameters, and you can drag waymarks on to other waymarks to swap their positions. You can also drag points from the circle calculator tab in this help window on to a waymark in the editor window to replace its coordinates with the ones from that calculator.

data.name: HelpWindowTextEditing2
data.value: Changes made in the editor window will not be applied until the "Save" button is clicked.

data.name: HelpWindowTextMaps1
data.value: The "Map View" window displays a copy of the applicable map(s) for the selected preset's duty. Any placed waymarks are shown on the map. If a zone has multiple submaps, you can switch between submaps using the dropdown in the lower right corner of the window. The world cordinates corresponding to your cursor position on the map are shown at the bottom right of the window. Please read the "Coordinates" tab of this help window if you wish to understand the game's internal coordinate systems, and their relationship to what is presented in-game to the player.

data.name: HelpWindowTextMaps2
data.value: When editing a preset, you can drag waymark icons on the map to adjust their positions. While you are doing this, the coordinate readout reflects the position of the marker, and not the position of your mouse. Please note that editing waymarks in this manner is not advised in areas that have uneven ground, as it is not possible to automatically adjust the Y coordinate to match the terrain.

data.name: HelpWindowTextMaps3
data.value: Please also note that the plugin cannot currently determine which waymarks are present on which submaps, so all waymarks are shown at their positions on all submaps (provided that they are within the map's bounds). For some rare cases (like e12s), the default submap is not the one in which you enter the area, so you will need to manually select the correct submap.

data.name: HelpWindowTextCoordinates2
data.value: The game internally uses a right-handed 3D coordinate system, with X running West to East, Y running down to up, and Z running North to South. The on-map coordinate system is a 2D projection of the XZ plane, with X running West to East, and Y running North to South. Please note that the coordinates presented in chat links or on the map widgets in game are scaled to arbitrary values, and the Y and Z axes are swapped. This plugin uses the game's internal coordinate systems as shown below:

data.name: HelpWindowTextCircleComputerWarningMessage
data.value: SE has banned people for placing out of bounds waymarks. Please use caution when creating or editing a preset using this calculator.

data.name: CircleComputerTextInstructions1
data.value: This calculator will compute radially symmetric points ("clock spots") with the information that you give it. You can then drag these into the preset editor to replace any waymarks with the calculated points, or you can use the buttons at the bottom of this pane.

data.name: ButtonCopyPointsfromCircleComputer
data.value: Copy these points into the editor

data.name: ButtonCreatePresetfromCircleComputer
data.value: Create a new preset using these points

data.name: MainWindowTextNoPresetsFound
data.value: No presets match the current filter.

data.name: TextBoxPromptImport
data.value: Paste a preset here and click "Import".

data.name: HelpBackupCurrentConfig
data.value: Copies the current config file to a backup folder in the Dalamud 'pluginConfigs' directory.

data.name: MapWindowTextNoMapsAvailable
data.value: No maps available for this zone.

data.name: ConfigOptionClickingPresetUnselects
data.value: Clicking the selected preset unselects it.

data.name: ConfigOptionOpenandClosewithGameWindow
data.value: Open and close library with the game's waymark window.

data.name: ConfigOptionAttachtoGameWindow
data.value: Attach library window to the game's waymark window.

data.name: ConfigOptionShowIDinZoneNames
data.value: Show ID numbers next to zone names.

data.name: HelpShowIDinZoneNames
data.value: Shows the internal Content Finder ID of the zone/duty in some places. Generally only used for debugging.

data.name: ConfigOptionShowPresetIndices
data.value: Show the index of the preset within the library.

data.name: HelpShowPresetIndices
data.value: The primary use of this is if you need to know the preset index to use within a text command. You can always leave this disabled if you only use the GUI.

data.name: ConfigOptionAllowPresetDragandDrop
data.value: Allow drag and drop reordering of presets.

data.name: ConfigOptionAllowZoneDragandDrop
data.value: Allow drag and drop reordering of zones.

data.name: HelpAllowZoneDragandDrop
data.value: If this is enabled, you can change the order of preset folders sorted by zone. New zones will be added at the bottom of the list. This option has no effect if the 'Categorize presets by zone' option is disabled.

data.name: ConfigOptionSortZonesDescending
data.value: Sort zones descending (newest at the top).

data.name: HelpSortZonesDescending
data.value: When this is checked, zones will be sorted roughly (SE's ordering isn't perfect) newest to oldest. When coupled with the "Allow drag and drop reordering of zones" option, new zones will be added at the top of the list (with everything else remaining in the same order below).

data.name: ConfigOptionShowLibraryZoneFilterSearchBox
data.value: Show search box to filter zones in library window.

data.name: HelpShowLibraryZoneFilterSearchBox
data.value: When this is checked, a search box will be shown at the top of the library window to filter the zones you want to see. This has no effect when the "Categorize presets by zone" option is disabled.

data.name: HelpAutoloadpresetsfromLibrary
data.value: Automatically loads the first five presets that exist in the library for a zone when you load into it. THIS WILL OVERWRITE THE GAME'S SLOTS WITHOUT WARNING, so please do not turn this on until you are certain that you have saved any data that you want to keep. Consider using this with the auto-import option below to reduce the risk of inadvertent preset loss.

data.name: HelpAutosavePresetstoLibrary
data.value: Automatically copies any populated game preset slots into the library upon exiting an instance.

data.name: HelpClearAllMapViewData
data.value: This deletes all map view pan/zoom/submap state, resetting every map back to default.

data.name: HelpClearAllZoneSortData
data.value: This deletes any custom ordering of the zones in the library window, and resets the sort order back to default.

data.name: InvalidDataWarning
data.value: Invalid editing data; something went very wrong. Please press 'Cancel' and try again.
